documents.document: @DianaElbasha However, semi-autonomous features like they have in Audis and Teslas really do make traffic more tolerable, allowing you to take your hand and feet off the gas and inch your car forward for you. https://t.co/FP7lqnVHOS

@DianaElbasha Less human error, fewer injuries, fewer deaths. Insurance companies hate this idea. Traffic could feasibly be eliminated if all cars spoke to each other on the same protocol. Until then, 66 at 5pm will still blow with a mix of human-driven cars and autonomous cars.

@DianaElbasha I could talk about this for days. For the record, fully autonomous driving is at least a couple decades away. What you see now is Stage 2 (of 5), so it's crude (and thus accidents still happen). But generally, the primary benefit is eliminating human error.

@beh_zod @Uber Yeah, I think thatâ€™s it. Weâ€™ve been down in San Bruno going between our hotels, dinners, and office. Seems like when they hear itâ€™s a short haul and not a trip to SF, theyâ€™re not interested. Pretty shitty practice tbh.

@rheannamartinez @Uber You always have to put your destination. But the Uber Driver App doesnâ€™t let the driver know your destination until they pick you up, presumably to prevent discrimination. Remember the days of DC cabs asking you where you were going? If you said Arlington, theyâ€™d drive off.

In SF and I and others Iâ€™m with have had an unusual number of @uber drivers screening our requests... they call, they ask where weâ€™re going and when we tell them, they cancel on us. What gives?

@cosentino @mattsmcl @HyersBill @OBEYGIANT Hereâ€™s a good @VICE segment on Matt and Billâ€™s work. https://t.co/KLrfBxNYnX

@cosentino @mattsmcl @HyersBill The discussions are being had and progress is being made. Politicians have gotten too caught up with relying on data and have forgotten about... well... people. And culture. No amount of data could have predicted the success of @OBEYGIANTâ€™s HOPE poster.

To all aspiring civic leaders and their campaign managers.
Creatives are experts at communicating ideas and messages.
You... arenâ€™t.
Learn to stay in your lane. Engage and empower creatives and let them work their magic. Donâ€™t squash their creativity. https://t.co/eOtmkWMoEZ
@cosentino Also encourage you to check out @mattsmcl and @HyersBillâ€™s brilliant work for @IronStache @CynthiaNixon @JohnFetterman and others. https://t.co/sMdbiiooR8
